description: Sr. Business Analyst Data Analytics Duties and Responsibilities: · Responsible formulating the best approach to solicit client’s business requirements. · Hold review sessions to collect the client’s business requirements and obtain their written approval. · Maintain and update the project artifacts as required. · Work closely with the Project Manager and get guidance for tasks. · Schedule scrum events, meetings, and prepare meeting minutes. · Develops and performs appropriate analyses and provide explanations of analysis, assumptions made, and assists in interpretation of results and implications. · Develops and reviews communication materials, summarize governance and policy information for business audience, develop key messaging around it. · Ability to work in highly matrixed team environment and collaborate across multiple work efforts. · Experienced with Agile methodology and utilizing Jira (or similar tool) for planning and monitoring. · Escalate appropriately and quickly as issues are identified. 1. Other duties as assigned Minimum Qualifications: (To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.)  Bachelor’s degree in Business or Information Technology. At least 5 - 7 years of experience working in Federal Health IT program/projects in an Agile environment. Excellent communication and written skills. Knowledge of Databases and Data Warehousing principles. Capable of examining existing Azure solutions functionality (Azure Data Factory, Azure DataBricks) and presenting it to Enterprise Data Office with gaps, opportunities, and reuse potential for each. Knowledge of Data Analytics tools like Tableau and Power BI. Proficient in Microsoft Office suites including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work with a multi-cultural team in a highly collaborative environment.  Job Type: Contract Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour Experience level:  6 years  Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Work Location: Remote

Position Summary  Provide data analysis, data management, and data reporting services for business systems.  This full-time position is performed from a home office anywhere in the Continental US.  Essential Duties/Responsibilities   Build and run data queries to identify data issues and exceptions and clean data  Monitor key data components to ensure data quality, including account and contact related data  Manage security roles that control access to key data sets  Handle sensitive data according to guidelines  Proactively work with business users to scope and implement data changes to support business processes and reporting  Analyze and interpret data to make it useful to the organization  Create and manage queries/views, reports, and dashboards for key business units  Report data analysis findings to management to inform business decisions and prioritize needs  Manage the reporting environment, including reporting tools, data and reporting requirements, and security  Develop expertise in the required data and processing for key business functions, including invoicing, event management, product management, and marketing  Assist organizational operations and internal users by providing technical support for issues related to key business systems  Report problems and coordinate resolution with external business system vendors  Manage timely resolution and delivery of solutions  Partner with other IT staff on projects  Complete work tasks and projects as directed by the Director of Business Systems  All other duties as assigned   Compensation and Benefits  Starting Salary Range: $70,100 - $82,000 annually; based on work experience, education, training, knowledge, skills, and internal and external equity.  Employees may choose from benefits including HDHP and copay medical plans, dental, vision, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts, health savings account, 403b retirement plan, and supplemental life and disability insurance. In addition, ACSI provides vacation, sick leave, paid holidays, basic life, basic accidental death and disability, long term disability, employee assistance plan, Christian school tuition benefit, and discretionary annual bonus.   Essential Qualifications  Spiritually the ideal candidate shall possess characteristics that reflect   a demonstrated acceptance without reservation of the ACSI Statement of Faith  a strong, clear Christian testimony, acknowledging Christ as Savior and seeking to live as His disciple  a desire for spiritual growth as evidenced by his/her prayer life, Bible study, and spiritual outreach to others  a mature, godly spirit  a Christian role model (Luke 6:40) in attitude, speech, and actions toward others. (This includes being committed to Gods biblical standards for sexual conduct.)  a person of faith and prayer  a broad acceptance of and by the evangelical Christian community  a strong knowledge and understanding of Scripture  a servant leader  an active participation in a local Bible-believing church   Required Experience and Education   Five or more years of experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst or in related field  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience  Ability to analyze existing business systems and data sets and provide recommendations to enhance business processes  Data reporting experience preferred  Proficiency in programming languages; SQL, XML. and JavaScript experience preferred  Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)  Strong listening and written and verbal communication skills with specific ability to translate technical details to a non-technical audience; great customer service skills  Ability to focus on customer needs and their critical business cycles and schedules  Demonstrated strong follow-through and consistently keep commitments to customers and employees with timely delivery of deadlines and projects  Demonstrated ability to effectively handle multiple projects and manage simultaneous priorities in a self-directed manner; strong organization skills  Proven ability to work successfully within a team and on an individual basis   Physical Demands and Work Environment   Professional remote work environment in which to conduct videoconferences and phone calls  Ability and willingness to travel up to 5% by plane or automobile  Drivers License required to be kept current and in effect as a condition of employment  Employee is regularly required to walk, sit, use hands and fingers, talk, and hear  Essential duties require the use of computers to process information  The employee frequently is required to reach with hands and arms  Specific vision abilities required by this job include the ability to read at close range and distinguish colors and contrasts

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.   Job Description  Responsible for working on big data/analytics projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis. Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action. Interprets data and analyze results using various statistical techniques and tools. Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions. Collaborate with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.     Basic Qualifications   Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience Five to seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience      Preferred Skills/Experience   Working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis and interpret data Experience in analytics, advanced analytics/statistics, predictive modeling Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Demonstrated project management skills Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills     If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.   Learn how the way we work at U.S. Bank drives meaningful relationships with our customers and collaboration across the company.   Benefits:  Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):   Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)  Basic term and optional term life insurance  Short-term and long-term disability  Pregnancy disability and parental leave  401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan  Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)  Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities  Adoption assistance  Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law    EEO is the Law  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal KNOW YOUR RIGHTS EEO poster.   E-Verify  U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.  The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, US Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401k contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $92,480.00 - $108,800.00 - $119,680.00  U.S. Bank will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Job Title: Sr. Analyst, Data Integration  Company: Tegria Revenue Cycle Management (Tegria RCM)  Department: Application Support Services  Leader: Manager, Data Integration  FLSA Status: Salaried/Exempt  Work Location: Remote within the U.S.  Travel: No travel required  Compensation: $54,400.00 - $101,135.00   OVERVIEW  The Senior Analyst, Data Integration, is responsible for the integration data platform and data acquisition of Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management services using the platform. They serve as the subject matter expert for the data and drive the data acquisition projects. The Senior Analyst also guides the team, supporting design, testing, process standardization, and training. This role will serve as an expert in Institutional and Professional billing data integration across diverse specifications and multiple applications as we transition legacy systems to our new data platform.  Responsibilities include:   Collaborates closely with operational product owners, analytics, engineering teams, QA, and third-party vendors to design and build enhancements and new features for the Data Platform or Data Implementation Processes.  Data acquisition project ownership to review and implement new accounts and systems; and to discuss and solve unique and repetitive data integration discrepancies.  Participate in daily stand-ups to provide progress updates on data implementations, development QA, and answer user story questions.  Creating and maintaining data specifications and applying those requirements to accurately configure and map data, utilizing database and file configuration processes.  Actively identify areas for improvement and collaborate across the business to implement change.  Lead data implementations ensuring effective management to track and report against objectives and success measures at regularly defined intervals to internal management.  Implement data governance and security protocols to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of our customer’s data.  Providing advanced root cause analysis and resolution guidance for identified data irregularities utilizing raw file review, ETL review, SQL, and other database technologies and queries  Find, isolate, document, and track bugs through resolution.  Lead test prep and execution activities, including test plans, test scenarios, and mapping of scenarios to business requirements.  Develop and maintain deliverables to support project execution, such as scoping documents, standard operating procedures, communication plans, and training plans.  Support training program design, development, assessment, and mentorship.  Support the execution and delivery of the Data Integration roadmap by populating & maintaining the backlog.  Document user stories to a high standard, working with development & testers to refine requirement, ensuring acceptance are captured accurately and understood.  Other duties as assigned    QUALIFICATIONS   A Computer Science or other related bachelor’s degree and 5 years relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience, may be considered  5 years of Project leadership experience, with 3 years in data acquisition projects  3 years of Demonstrated skill & ability to mentor and train others in the following areas:   Microsoft Excel (Macros, VB editor, power query)  SQL and relational databases to aggregate, gather, and manipulate data  ETL methodologies and tools  Data quality processes (design & application) of quality tests (unit, integration tests, end-to-end, and regression tests).  Data Profiling (source systems, sources of record, end-to-end solution support, data movements)   3 years’ Experience with and strong understanding of health care data, and 1-year specific knowledge of revenue cycle transaction sets preferred  FTM applications and tools to design and configure file processing and resolve file processing configuration discrepancies. (i.e., FileZilla, MoveIt, Automate)  1 year with product and software development techniques and agile methodologies, 1-year   Preferred Qualifications:   Platform owner or product owner-associated experience  Experience using Azure Databricks  Familiarity with Python    Physical Requirements:  The physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Listed below are the physical requirements required while performing the duties of this job.   The employee is regularly required to: stand; sit; talk; hear; use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard; and reach, stoop and/or kneel to install computer equipment  The employee must have the specific vision ability to complete close vision requirements due to computer work  The employee is required to be able to complete light to moderate lifting   Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  We welcome and respect the variety of experiences, viewpoints, and cultural backgrounds that everyone brings to our workplace. Tegria RCM makes every effort to promote a workplace where leaders model inclusive behaviors and individuals feel respected, valued, and empowered. Together, we promote and sustain an inclusive workplace where people feel a sense of belonging

Company Overview:  Shriners Children’s is a family that respects, supports, and values each other. We are engaged in providing excellence in patient care, embracing multi-disciplinary education, and research with global impact. We foster a learning environment that values evidenced based practice, experience, innovation, and critical thinking. Our compassion, integrity, accountability, and resilience defines us as leaders in pediatric specialty care for our children and their families.   Job Overview:  Shriners Children's is the premier pediatric burn, orthopaedic, spinal cord injury, cleft lip and palate, and pediatric subspecialties medical center. We have an opportunity for a remote Epic Application Analyst, Business Intelligence reporting into our Corporate Headquarters.   The Epic Application Analyst, Business Intelligence will possess working experience in Epic, including experience working within Clarity, Caboodle, the Radar framework, and SlicerDicer. Candidate will be responsible for partnering with operations to understand a problem, and be able to design and develop reports and dashboards within the Cogito framework to meet the business need.   Responsibilities:  Responsibilities include reviewing assigned portions of business or clinical operations to identify clients’ information system’s needs; defining processes, problems and requirements; performing cost/benefit analyses; performing assignments for the design and analysis of clinical and business information systems to meet client’s needs.   Qualifications:  The qualified candidate will possess knowledge of physician/hospital workflow; strong analytical skills and critical thinking skills regarding the collection and compilation of data and ability to identify trends; demonstrated experience in leading change, customer advocacy, and continuous improvement methodologies, as well as possessing excellent communication skills and the ability to build good relationships with clinics and/or providers. A BA/BS Degree - or 5 years of equivalent clinical or information services experience - is required. The qualified candidate must hold current Epic Certifications in one or more Epic applications or achieve certification within 180 days. The preferred candidate will hold Epic Certifications in Cogito, Caboodle Data Model, and Clarity Data Model (ambulatory clinical experience preferred). SQL experience developing reports and extracts across Clarity and Caboodle are key in this role. Consulting with operations to determine the logical design for new business solutions according to Epic data structure is important , as is work with operational stakeholders to triage and prioritize analytics requests .Off hours work and participation in on-call rotation are required.

Responsibilities:  Budget Operating Plans (BOP)    Prepare budget operating plans (BOP), post expenses, obligations, and updates to the BOP daily  Plan and facilitate budget update meetings and provide meeting minutes  Continually monitor the BOP and make projections, including researching variances and documenting revised projections in monthly variance reports daily  Research and respond to customer inquiries regarding budget estimates, invoices, business documents, and other business-related matters as necessary daily  Gather and analyze data for annual business planning process  Provide reports timely and accurate to include status updates for assigned tasks, unliquidated obligations, and pending receivables  Download financial reports and check Budget Operating Plan (BOP) daily for budget items due within 30 days  Send emails to PM/COR to validate budget item is still needed  Verify the Period of Performance’s (PoP) and term of item  Review and check all required documents and all documents have been uploaded by package builder (LEAF)  Review BOP for obligations and Purchase Order (PO) numbers until award daily  Contact COR or CO for copy of final contract for reference  Check and review new LEAF entries daily. needed   Software Tools Used:    Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Power BI, Teams, Outlook, SharePoint  Apptio  VA software: iFAMS, LEAF, ARM, BTT  Qualifications:  Professional knowledge of the theory, principles, concepts, and practices of accounting to apply this knowledge to broad and difficult assignments  Ability to develop and promulgate accounting policies and standards covering operations, to solve problems of above average difficulty in maintaining accounting systems  Thorough knowledge of governmental accounting practices and procedures including those established by GAO, 0MB, Department of Treasury, and the agency to design, modify, administer, or analyze accounting systems or programs  Ability to write reports to develop staff papers that accurately reflect findings and recommendations regarding fiscal and accounting operations  Ability to deal tactfully and convincingly with staff members from outside offices regarding the coordination of policies and procedures  Knowledge and experience with Technology Business Management (TBM) framework     Education:    A Bachelor’s degree in Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, Cost Accounting or related FINSYNC is looking for an accomplished Data Engineer/Data Analyst to own data pipeline end to end, including data ingestion, curation, modeling and visualizations. This role will ensure proper data architecture and processes to support data initiatives at scale.  Successful Candidates Have:   5+ years of designing and implementing data solutions  5+ years experience developing data models to support credit and underwriting use cases  Deep understanding of methods to transform source data into refined data catalogs for immediate and seamless consumption in presentation layer  5+ years creating scalable data pipelines all the way to the consumption from customers and internal business partners  Experience with side variety visualizations tools such as Qlik Cloud (preferred), MS PowerBI, Tableau  Experience analyzing both quantitative and qualitative data and understanding best practices for visualization  Experience with SQL and similar programming languages  Strong passion for data quality and data governance   Job Responsibilities:   Maintain and extend data pipeline for all data initiatives  Support data initiatives by developing data models and visualizations  Work collaboratively with stakeholders to ensure data quality and relevance  Make recommendations on changes to source data to more efficiently support business use cases  Support the integration and consumption of data into other platforms and systems   What We Can Offer You for All Your Hard Work?   Competitive compensation package  Full suite of health & welfare benefits including medical, PTO & 401(k)  Workplace flexibility and collaboration with a virtual-first team   ABOUT THE COMPANY  We sync with over 7,000 banks and credit unions to provide the approximately 32 million small businesses in the United States a simpler way to manage finances with the software and services they need, all in one platform. After a business syncs their bank account to FINSYNC, our software helps them send and receive payments, process payroll, automate accounting and manage cash flow with less time and better results working with financial partners (bankers, credit card processors, accountants, and insurance agents) who use our software to deliver unmatched services. The result: financial harmony, peace of mind and the best way to succeed.  We cultivate a culture of:   Teamwork (like a pro sports team) without ego  Constructive communication so we can build transparency and trust  Metrics that matter personally, professionally, and financially  High performance merits high compensation  Self-motivation and self-discipline merits flat organization  Time management and work-life-harmony   Finsync is on a mission to improve the lives of others by helping them succeed in business and in life, doing more business with less time and better results so they can invest their time and successes in other ways meaningful to them.

About us: ATX Consulting is a leading Austin TX-based IT consulting and staffing firm specializing in State of Texas and local government contracts. **C2C/ TX residents only/ Remote What we are looking for:The Worker is responsible for performing advanced business and systems analysis work that involves gathering, developing, and documenting business processes, and recommendations. Also conducts research and special project work. The position will work in concert with appropriate internal and external stakeholders to support the organization’s long-term business goals/strategy for the agency’s case management system. Excellent communication and presentation skills are required for developing reports, fiscal notes, and presentations. Familiarity with child and adult welfare case management practices is required. This role may also be responsible for the following:  Seeking, gathering and analyzing information from internal and external stakeholders and subject matter experts. Converting findings into meaningful documentation for use by the division leadership team. Communicating with technical, non-technical, functional, management and senior level staff. Working within cross-functional teams. Taking initiative to develop and foster a collaborative approach among teams before, during and after the requirements gathering process to achieve a common mission, vision, values and goals.  The Worker must have a strong Business Analysis background with extensive experience in the following:  Experience with analyzing and/or implementing child welfare case management systems. Experience with analyzing and/or implementing systems meeting the requirements for a Comprehensive Child Welfare Information System (CCWIS). Assessing an organization’s readiness for change. Strategic planning for an enterprise organization. Robust skills facilitating and leading groups, to include senior level leadership teams, to clarify and define project goals, needs, scope and priorities, as well as delivering presentations for meetings involving cross-functional teams and including stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills to provide clear and consistent status updates and inform stakeholders and agency leadership of project progress. Solid experience with the Microsoft Suite of tools (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, MS Project, and Visio). Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Management Life Cycle (PMLC) methodologies. Communicating and listening in a way that is focused on clear expression of, as well as understanding of ideas and concepts that ultimately lead to positive outcomes and results. Knowledge of Texas Project Delivery Framework.  Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $100.00 - $102.00 per hour Schedule:  Monday to Friday  Experience:  knowledge of child welfare systems: 5 years (Preferred) Business Analyst: 8 years (Required) Ability to summarize analysis and make key recommendations: 6 years (Required) Use Case documentation and User Stories: 5 years (Required)  Work Location: Remote

EDI Business Analyst (Transportation, Logistics) Job Type: Contract Duration: 6 months with possible extension Location:  Remote or Onsite (Preference to candidates in Jacksonville, FL) Leneer is seeking an EDI Business Analyst with Transportation, Logistics experience to support our client in the Transportation and Logistics space. Summary of Role: The EDI BA will support tasks related to the Land Transportation EDI implementation onboarding process. The EDI BA will gather and provide EDI requirements and specifications to an EDI developer which includes the interpretation of what the partner is going to be sending you in an EDI format, usually X12 to the Client’s TMS (Blue Yonder/TMW). Then the EDI Developer will do the EDI mapping. The EDI BA will take ownership once EDI map has been developed to test it with business unit (or user acceptance testing), set up anything that needs to be set up in the EDI application, and then implement (onboard) the Client’s customer. The EDI BA must have people skills, be a quick learner, and be willing to ask questions.. Job Responsibilities:  Gathers EDI requirements, works with Developers on mapping, and tests EDI solutions to ensure Production success Researches, defines, documents and translates business needs and objectives into system requirements that can be converted into applications  Deliverables Include:  Analyze data integration and EDI requirements Translate business needs and objectives into system requirements Develops test plan to test the solution and document results for review Deliver EDI implementations on time Provide project management  Qualifications and Requirements:  Strong customer relationship skills and confidence working directly with client’s customers to determine EDI requirements Experience analyzing data integration and electronic data interchange (EDI) requirements Background in Transportation EDI preferable Sterling Integrator ANSI X12 (204, 210, 214, 300, 301, 304, 309, 310, 315, 323, 990) EDIFACT, XML FTP, SFTP, HTTP/S, AS2, VAN TMS Knowledgeable of Applications: Blue Yonder / TMW (preferable)  Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour Experience level:  5 years  Schedule:  8 hour shift  Application Question(s):  What is your desired hourly rate? Do you have a Linkedin profile? If so, please include the link.
